issue.title: [Go] add shmem allocator
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-4852](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4852). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Go-Arrow doesn't implement the IPC protocol yet.

in the meantime, to exchange data with other languages, a nice close gap solution would be to have a shmem allocator where one would put Arrow arrays.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4852?focusedCommentId=16791547) by Miki Tebeka (tebeka):*
I'm thinking of having a go at this using my initial implementation at <https://github.com/353solutions/go-arrow-py>, however I'd like to make sure this is useful first :)

Assume I've created a Table in Go using shared memory allocator, how can I reference the table on the Python side?

`[~sbinet]`?
